name: Broiled Salmon Gyros with Cucumber Feta Yogurt Dip
description: A healthy, protein-packed gyro with an easy homemade Greek yogurt dip!
recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
2  whole wheat pita pockets (split into 4 halves)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine Greek yogurt, feta, cucumber, oregano, garlic and onion powder, salt and pepper, to taste. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, allowing the flavors to meld.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium bowl, combine Greek yogurt, feta, cucumber, oregano, garlic and onion powder, salt and pepper, to taste. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, allowing the flavors to meld.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to broil. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to broil. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Place salmon onto prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Broil until pink, about 5 minutes. Gently flip and broil until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before flaking into 1/2-inch pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Place salmon onto prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Broil until pink, about 5 minutes. Gently flip and broil until the fish flakes easily with a fork, about 5 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before flaking into 1/2-inch pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: To assemble the gyro, stuff pita halves with salmon, spinach and dip. Serve immediately with lemon wedges, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: To assemble the gyro, stuff pita halves with salmon, spinach and dip. Serve immediately with lemon wedges, if desired.
